services.name: Audience Sentiment Analyzer
services.overview: The Audience Sentiment Analyzer is a real-time feedback and engagement tool designed to provide live event organizers, content creators, and marketing teams with immediate insights into audience sentiment. By leveraging advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques, the system analyzes audience interactions across various platforms, including live chat, social media streams, and real-time surveys, to gauge the overall emotional response to the event or content being presented. This information empowers users to adapt their content, engagement strategies, and event flow dynamically, leading to increased audience satisfaction, improved event ROI, and enhanced content relevance. The system provides a comprehensive sentiment dashboard displaying aggregate sentiment scores, identified trending topics, and customizable alerts for significant sentiment shifts. This ensures the event team can react quickly and appropriately to audience feedback, maximizing the impact of the live experience.
problems_addressed: Lack of real-time feedback during live events, hindering immediate content adjustments.
Difficulty in accurately gauging overall audience sentiment from disparate communication channels.
Inability to proactively address negative sentiment trends before they impact the event's success.
Manual effort required to collect and analyze audience feedback, resulting in delayed insights.
target_users: Event Organizers – seeking to maximize attendee engagement and ROI.
Content Creators – aiming to optimize content relevance and audience satisfaction.
Marketing Teams – striving to enhance brand perception and campaign effectiveness.
Live Stream Producers - needing real-time insights to adjust programming.
core_features: Real-time Sentiment Analysis – NLP-powered analysis of live chat, social media, and survey data to identify overall sentiment (positive, negative, neutral) and specific emotion categories (e.g., joy, excitement, frustration).

Sentiment Dashboard – Centralized dashboard displaying aggregate sentiment scores, sentiment trends over time, and key themes driving audience emotion. Includes customizable alert thresholds for significant sentiment shifts.

Multi-Platform Integration – Seamless integration with popular live streaming platforms (e.g., YouTube Live, Twitch, Facebook Live), social media channels (e.g., Twitter, Instagram), and survey tools (e.g., SurveyMonkey, Typeform).
Customizable Sentiment Categories – Ability to define and track specific sentiment categories relevant to the event or content (e.g., interest in a particular product, excitement about a speaker).
Automated Reporting – Generation of post-event reports summarizing overall sentiment, key trends, and actionable insights for future event planning.
Keyword and Topic Extraction – Identification of trending keywords and topics within audience interactions to understand specific points of interest or concern.
user_journeys: Event organizer logs into the Sentiment Analyzer platform, configures integrations with the live streaming platform and social media channels, sets up custom sentiment categories, monitors the sentiment dashboard during the live event, receives alerts when negative sentiment spikes, adjusts content based on the insights, and generates a post-event report for analysis.
ai_capabilities: NLP model for sentiment analysis: fine-tuned BERT or RoBERTa model trained on event-specific text data to accurately classify sentiment from chat messages, social media posts, and survey responses.
Topic modeling using LDA or NMF to identify key themes and topics driving audience sentiment.
Keyword extraction using TF-IDF or other methods to identify trending keywords and phrases in real-time.
Anomaly detection algorithms to identify sudden shifts in sentiment that require immediate attention.

Model Selection Notes: Use Hugging Face Transformers library for pre-trained models. Fine-tune the models on a dataset of labeled text data relevant to the industry (e.g., concert reviews, event feedback, etc.). Implement vector search with embeddings to categorize new content quickly.

input_data_types: Live chat messages from streaming platforms.
Social media posts (Twitter, Instagram) mentioning the event or related keywords.
Survey responses collected during the event.
Event metadata (e.g., event name, description, speakers, schedule).
data_schema_recommendations: Chat messages: {timestamp: datetime, user_id: string, message: string}
Social media posts: {timestamp: datetime, user_id: string, post_text: string, platform: string}
Survey responses: {user_id: string, question_id: string, answer: string}
Event metadata: {event_id: string, event_name: string, description: string, start_time: datetime, end_time: datetime}
data_sources: Streaming platform APIs (e.g., Twitch API, YouTube Data API).
Social media APIs (e.g., Twitter API, Instagram Graph API).
Survey platform APIs (e.g., SurveyMonkey API, Typeform API).
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: GDPR compliance for handling user data. Ensure data anonymization and secure storage of personal information. CCPA compliance if users are located in California. Get consent to analyze chat data and social media content.

required_integrations: CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) for lead generation and customer engagement.
Analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) for tracking platform usage and user behavior.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 for accessing social media and survey platform APIs. JWT for securing internal API endpoints. Clerk/Auth0 for user authentication and authorization on the Sentiment Analyzer platform.

technical_specifications.architecture: Microservices architecture with separate services for data ingestion, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, API gateway, and frontend. Real-time data processing pipeline using Kafka or similar message queue. API layer built with REST. Frontend built with Next.js. Backend with Node.js. Database with Planetscale.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes for chat messages, social media posts, survey responses, and event metadata
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing processed data and reports
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for text embeddings, Hugging Face Transformers library for pre-trained models, Pinecone / Supabase vectors for vector search
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend services

API_design: POST /api/analyze-sentiment – Analyzes sentiment of input text. Payload: {text: string}. Response: {sentiment: string, score: float}
GET /api/event/{event_id}/sentiment – Retrieves sentiment data for a specific event. Response: {overall_sentiment: string, sentiment_trend: array, key_topics: array}
GET /api/event/{event_id}/topics – Retrieves trending topics for a specific event. Response: {topics: array}
POST /api/event/{event_id}/feedback - Endpoint to receive event feedback from the client. Payload: {feedback: string}.
frontend_components: Sentiment Dashboard Component – Displays real-time sentiment scores and trends.
Topic Cloud Component – Visualizes trending topics and keywords.
Alerting Component – Displays customizable alerts based on sentiment thresholds.
Integration Management Component - Allows users to connect various streaming and social media platforms.

deployment_instructions: Environment Variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, TWITTER_API_KEY, YOUTUBE_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY.
Vercel Deployment Steps: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel, configure environment variables, enable automatic deployments on push.
Build Outputs and Runtime Settings: Configure Next.js build settings for frontend, Node.js runtime for backend, and database connection settings for Planetscale. Specify appropriate Node.js version.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on event size and usage volume (e.g., number of events, data processed).
Usage-based pricing for additional data processing or API requests.
Freemium model with limited features and usage for small events.
customer_segments: Small businesses hosting webinars and online events.
Mid-market companies organizing conferences and trade shows.
Enterprises producing large-scale live events and broadcasts.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: System uptime, API response time, data ingestion latency.
AI performance KPIs: Sentiment analysis accuracy, topic modeling coherence, keyword extraction precision.

Adoption/engagement KPIs: Number of active users, event usage frequency, feature adoption rate, user satisfaction scores, increased audience engagement during live events (measured by chat activity, social media mentions, and survey response rates).
